碰.definition: to touch; to meet with; to bump

碰一鼻子灰.definition: lit. to have one's nose rubbed in the dirt; fig. to meet with a sharp rebuff

碰上.definition: to run into; to come upon; to meet

碰到.definition: to come across; to run into; to meet; to hit

碰壁.definition: to hit a wall; (fig.) to hit a brick wall; to hit a snag; to have the door slammed in one's face

碰巧.definition: by chance; by coincidence; to happen to

碰撞造山.definition: collisional orogeny; mountain building as a result of continents colliding

碰擊.definition: to knock against; to knock together; to rattle

碰瓷.definition: (coll.) to scam sb by setting up an "accident" in which one appears to have sustained damage or injury caused by the scam victim, then demanding compensation (variations include putting "expensive" porcelain in a place where it is likely to be knocked over by passers-by, and stepping into the path of a slow-moving car)

碰見.definition: to run into; to meet (unexpectedly); to bump into

碰運氣.definition: to try one's luck; to leave sth to chance

碰面.definition: to meet; to run into (sb); to get together (with sb)

碰頭.definition: to meet; to hold a meeting
